title: Amphenomenon
author: Amphenomenon
content: My people, I know say bitcoin nor dey banned but only say cbn government put restriction and we dey see say all their plan to control/restrict growth of Bitcoin for Nigeria nor dey work even the eNaira nor even do anything. I go like know which laws about bitcoin whona reason say government fit put for Nigeria way go favour the economy?

comments.author: DaNNy001
comments.body: Quote from: Amphenomenon on July 25, 2023, 03:48:56 PM My people, I know say bitcoin nor dey banned but only say cbn government put restriction and we dey see say all their plan to control/restrict growth of Bitcoin for Nigeria nor dey work even the eNaira nor even do anything. I go like know which laws about bitcoin whona reason say government fit put for Nigeria way go favour the economy? This our country na so so short sighted politicians nai full and na all of them just dey after their interest especially that fool emefiele wey put this law on crypto ban with banks but still on still btc and crypto still dey thrive well even with their ban on so for me I feel they should just lift that ban restricting banks from transacting but I no naija e day hard for them to go back on their word.

comments.author: CryptoHeadlineNews
comments.body: Quote from: Amphenomenon on July 25, 2023, 03:48:56 PM My people, I know say bitcoin nor dey banned but only say cbn government put restriction and we dey see say all their plan to control/restrict growth of Bitcoin for Nigeria nor dey work even the eNaira nor even do anything. I go like know which laws about bitcoin whona reason say government fit put for Nigeria way go favour the economy? For me, the only thing wey I for like make Federal government do to encourage Bitcoin na to create a conducive atmosphere to enable people trade and transact their coin in peace, because nothing sweet pass say when you want buy Bitcoin, you fit just use either your MasterCard or Visa carry run transactions without limits placed by CBN at ease, without needing to create several online dollar wallets, of which government dey still miss a lot too, because imagine if they fit regulate Bitcoin con dey collect charges per each transaction, na really big money be that oh, wey for in one way or the other help the economy grow.

comments.author: royalfestus
comments.body: I earnestly desire that the government refrains from imposing regulations or interfering with cryptocurrencies. It would be best if they let this innovative space thrive without unnecessary intervention. My sole aspiration is for them to permit the seamless exchange and deposit of fiat currency, such as dollars or pounds, into our domiciliary accounts

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: Quote from: Amphenomenon on July 25, 2023, 03:48:56 PMI go like know which laws about bitcoin whona reason say government fit put for Nigeria way go favour the economy? There is nothing better than the government to legalize bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies. All those exchanges that Nigerians are using should be taxed. Also Nigerians should pay their 10% capital gain tax.Quote from: CryptoHeadlineNews on July 25, 2023, 09:07:03 PMFor me, the only thing wey I for like make Federal government do to encourage Bitcoin na to create a conducive atmosphere to enable people trade and transact their coin in peace, because nothing sweet pass say when you want buy Bitcoin, you fit just use either your MasterCard or Visa carry run transactions without limits placed by CBN at easeNigerians have the conducive environment within themselves as they do not depend on CBN and the banks before they can trade between and within themselves.I will prefer the way we trade now than the profit to be centralized on payment gateway like Mastercard. But using such cards might make the transaction faster. Trading within ourselves too is not that slow, it depends on the buyer or seller. I have done many of such transactiona that are very fast.Another thing to consider is if the payment gateway will use I&E window or the parallel market price. Even after the naira unification, people will still likely gain better if they use parallel market. Recently, dollar increased to $870 in the parallel market, it was around $777 in I&E window at the time. But if Nigeria government legalize cryptocurrencies, I do not know how the exchange rate would be. Or likely some traders may see arbitraging opportunities.

comments.author: Coyster
comments.body: Quote from: royalfestus on July 25, 2023, 09:24:06 PMI earnestly desire that the government refrains from imposing regulations or interfering with cryptocurrencies.E no dey possible say the Nigerian government no go interfere for crypto matter, and no be only the Nigerian government wey dey do am, crypto dey regulated for many countries, the government talk say the risk involved dey too much, thus regulation go help to protect those wey dey involved, clear regulation go also help the government to make money from the industry through tax.Wetin me i wan see na the regulatory framework wey Naija government go carry come, if e no go dey too strict, then e go make sense, wetin dey vex me be say our government wan dey collect tax when CBN ban crypto and when dem never begin regulate am.

comments.body: First na for our government to regulate crypto matter and make e de favourable to us wey de into am, so we go get a clear vision of crypto relationship with our government. E go be win win for us wey de into bitcoin and our government, because we go de sure of enabling environment to trade and invest in bitcoin and government go de happily cash in for di tax wey dem go de collect from us.

comments.author: Wiwo
comments.body: Quote from: Amphenomenon on July 25, 2023, 03:48:56 PM My people, I know say bitcoin nor dey banned but only say cbn government put restriction and we dey see say all their plan to control/restrict growth of Bitcoin for Nigeria nor dey work even the eNaira nor even do anything. I go like know which laws about bitcoin whole reason say government fit put for Nigeria way go favor the economy? Baba truth be told, this thread lack direction because from the topic one will think is about individual vs government benefits from Bitcoin,  and how Bitcoin has better both government and individual at all level within the Nigeria space.Secondly, in the first paragraph, you dived into the action of the central bank of Nig against Bitcoin, and how they made an attempt to either create something that could compete with Bitcoin or become a Bitcoin replacement in Nigeria in the form of the e-naira, but then you have to note one thing that e-naira doesn't have the features of a cryptocurrency and can not be used as an alternative to Bitcoin.The only way I think the fovernmen6can benefit from Bitcoin that will impact directly on the economy is in the area of cryptocurrencies income tax and in doing so, Nigeria has to first of all draft out crypto regulations and policy framework that can help the government generate income for the Bitcoin/crypto volume generated in Nigeria.
